  • Method Details

    • binaryString

      public static String binaryString(int decimal, int amount, int signed)
      Converts a decimal integer to a binary string representation with the specified number of bits. If the binary representation is shorter than the specified amount of bits, it extends or truncates the binary string accordingly. If signed is set to 1, it extends the binary string with the sign bit, considering the value as a signed integer.
      Parameters:
      decimal - the decimal integer to convert to binary.
      amount - the number of bits in the resulting binary string.
      signed - specifies whether the binary string should be signed or unsigned (0 for unsigned, 1 for signed).
      Returns:
      the binary string representation of the decimal integer with the specified number of bits.

    • hexString

      public static String hexString(int value, int signExtension)
      Converts an integer value to a hexadecimal string representation with sign extension.
      Parameters:
      value - the integer value to convert.
      signExtension - specifies whether to perform sign extension (1 for signed, 0 for unsigned).
      Returns:
      the hexadecimal string representation of the integer value.

    • binaryToHex

      public static String binaryToHex(String binaryString)
      Converts a binary string to its hexadecimal string representation.
      Parameters:
      binaryString - the binary string to convert.
      Returns:
      the hexadecimal string representation of the binary string.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of the binary string is not a multiple of 4.
